TopicTitle: Kerbal Space Program 1.1 Hype Train Thread.

Articles.Content: Seems like there should be a thread about how it's playing. It's an open beta (for people who happen to have steam, vs the rest of us), so shouldn't it be OK to show it, or at least talk about it on the forums?
Why are there more posts, on the hype train, about a lack of hype than posts about hype?

I think the train's structure is still oscillating from running over a hump in the tracks (the divide caused by the open beta) and it's quite distracting.

@tater They will be allowed to post videos and the like, on the forums discussion will be contained in a dedicated board.

Edited March 13, 2016 by KerbonautInTraining
Buzzsaw Aerospace would be happy to supply a VTOL aircraft to retrieve some Hype from the secret government bunkers at Area 5.1
Hype Train of 2010 passing over Hype Creek Bridge with some Hype lightning caused by the Hype storm.

1 hour ago, tater said:

Seems like there should be a thread about how it's playing. It's an open beta (for people who happen to have steam, vs the rest of us), so shouldn't it be OK to show it, or at least talk about it on the forums?

When the prerelease starts there will be a separate forum section for 1.1 discussion.

22 minutes ago, KerbonautInTraining said:

I think the train's structure is still oscillating from running over a hump in the tracks (the divide caused by the open beta) and it's quite distracting.

@tater They will be allowed to post videos and the like, on the forums discussion will be contained in a dedicated board.

Thanks, I think I was under the misunderstanding it had already started, since I am not going to be able to try it as I'm a 2d class hype train rider (non-steam) I read the initial announcement, then stopped paying attention because it doesn't do me any good.

Edited March 13, 2016 by tater

People who are upset about not being able to do the public beta because they don't have steam seem to be misunderstanding what the public beta is for. The public beta is not a gift to players, it's a gift from players. It's not going to be fun to play. It's meant for testing the inevitably buggy game on a massive scale.
How do I do the Opt in prerelease, I'm using steam, and i also have no idea how to update the game.

Just now, Table said:

How do I do the Opt in prerelease, I'm using steam, and i also have no idea how to update the game.

It's not out yet.

1 minute ago, GregroxMun said:

It's not out yet.

Oh, nvm.

 

IM AN IDIOT

OK, my big chariot rover kinda, sorta looks like a train car, good enough for me!!!

I'm onboard!!!!!!  WOOO HOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

7 hours ago, Mad Rocket Scientist said:

Why are there more posts, on the hype train, about a lack of hype than posts about hype?

Good question.

On one hand, I've been so excited for this for months (I was sure they'd have it out before Christmas!) that I'm almost apathetic now. But every so often it hits me like "holy [kerbal excrement]! It's coming! The performance boost, the graphics, the 64bit, so much everything!". At the current rate 1.1 will be released right in the middle of my final exams... so I'm planning on just hiring a barista nurse to give me caffeine direct through IV.

7 minutes ago, SgtSomeone said:

But every so often it hits me like "holy [kerbal excrement]! It's coming! The performance boost, the graphics, the 64bit, so much everything!"

Exactly.

What's happening is the hype train has been accelerating for days at a rate that is imperceptible to the people inside. By now we're well past Mach 2. Or something.

(I just noticed that this entire thread is pretty much full of roleplay. Hype doesn't care about mortals and their "rules")

Edited March 14, 2016 by KerbonautInTraining

2 hours ago, tdonovan4 said:

Good question.

For an 11 month wait, it's not exactly overflowing with new things.  A new landing gear and an inflatable heat shield.  Yeah, it's nice to have 64-bit support, nice they're on a new game engine, and nice that they're fixing and tweaking stuff, but to me that's just things that should have been done in the .9's.  I'm not hyped by 2 parts and making an actual release candidate nearly one year after being released.
Can't wait for the opt-in! Can't wait for the x64!

At this speed the hype train will be picking up hitch hikers that are walking next to it! It needs a couple of good kickbacks strapped to the end. Followed by a mad scramble of people trying to hop on the train.

2 hours ago, ArmchairGravy said:

For an 11 month wait, it's not exactly overflowing with new things.  A new landing gear and an inflatable heat shield.  Yeah, it's nice to have 64-bit support, nice they're on a new game engine, and nice that they're fixing and tweaking stuff, but to me that's just things that should have been done in the .9's.  I'm not hyped by 2 parts and making an actual release candidate nearly one year after being released.

Wow!  11 months... 

I'm reminded of the iPhone 3s release when a raging fanboy blogged, "And I shaved my B@££s for this?!"

I hope the hype is worth it. 

I expect there needs to be some maintenance on the hype train. Must be rusted after all these months languishing in station.
Ah, Monday and a new week.

7 hours ago, KerbonautInTraining said:

Exactly.

What's happening is the hype train has been accelerating for days at a rate that is imperceptible to the people inside. By now we're well past Mach 2. Or something.

(I just noticed that this entire thread is pretty much full of roleplay. Hype doesn't care about mortals and their "rules")

Actually we're just barely at orbital velocity around Earth as of this morning. Of course it doesn't mean much of anything because we're travelling in metaspace, not space normal. Speed is not the measure of Hype of a Hype Train, the same way Velocity is not the measure of power of a Rocket. Instead, acceleration is what matters, and we are barely accelerating at standard gravity (9.8 m/s^2).

People who are upset about not being able to do the public beta because they don't have steam seem to be misunderstanding what the public beta is for. The public beta is not a gift to players, it's a gift from players. It's not going to be fun to play. It's meant for testing the inevitably buggy game on a massive scale.

People aren't complaining any more, bringing it up randomly will only make the problem worse
I'm unofficially riding the hype train! (like that ghost from the polar express!)
